title: How do the current state of the art CO2-Lithium batteries work? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t think there is such a thing. If it existed it would be a useful way to capture to CO2, but it would need its own supply as there isn’t alot of CO2 in the atmostphere for reaction purposes. There is a lithium air (or oxygen) battery, that I think works by oxidising Lithium with acid as opposed to using lithium ions sorted in a matrix. It has an energy density similar to diesel. but doesn’t last for very long in cycle life. Aluminium air batteries are also a high energy density (abour 2/3s of diesel) but can’t be recharged. Both could be a solution for aviation.
